text: The following list shows the line of descent for major winners from the Northern Dancer sire line, tracking patrilineal descent from the stallion dubbed by the New York Times in 1990 as "the dominant progenitor of his breed". It focuses on winners of the principal three-year-old Classic races, as these have long been used to evaluate a stallion's success, and the highest quality races for older horses based on International Federation of Horseracing Authorities rankings. A few other highly prestigious races from around the world have been included as well. Northern Dancer's first major winner was Nijinsky, who swept the English Triple Crown in 1970. Nijinsky in turn established himself as a leading sire, as did several other of Northern Dancer's sons, especially Danzig, Storm Bird (through his son Storm Cat) and Sadler's Wells. Modern descendants of Northern Dancer's sire line include American Triple Crown winner Justify (2018) and the majority of recent English Classic winners including the undefeated Frankel. Although not covered by the following list, Northern Dancer's influence is magnified in modern pedigrees by the success of several of his male descendants as broodmare sires. Triple Crown winner American Pharoah and leading sire Tapit are just two examples of horses who descend from Northern Dancer in an indirect line. ==Races included and number of winners== The following races were selected based on notability (for example, the English Classic and American triple crown races), quality (as measured by the IFHA ranking of the top 100 G1 races), and geography (to sample racing from around the world). This list also shows how many winners of the given race descend from the Northern Dancer sire line . Three-year-old classics: *2000 Guineas – 25 *1000 Guineas – 21 *Epsom Derby – 29 *Epsom Oaks – 22 *St Leger – 21 *Kentucky Derby – 6 *Preakness Stakes – 12 *Belmont Stakes – 8 *Kentucky Oaks – 10 *Coaching Club American Oaks (CCAO) – 6 *Poule d'Essai des Poulains – 27 *Poule d'Essai des Pouliches – 16 *Prix du Jockey Club – 19 *Prix de Diane – 19 *Irish 2000 Guineas – 27 *Irish 1000 Guineas – 21 *Irish Derby – 35 *Irish Oaks – 23 * Deutsches Derby – 14 * Randwick Guineas – 17 * Rosehill Guineas – 16 * Australian Derby – 15 * Australian Oaks – 12 *Satsuki Sho (Japanese 2000 Guineas) – 4 *Oka Sho (Japanese 1000 Guineas) – 6 *Tokyo Yushun (Japanese Derby) – 6 *Yushun Himba (Japanese Oaks) – 11 *Kikuka Sho (Japanese St. Leger) – 3 Top rated races: * Black Caviar Lightning – 18/21 * Dubai World Cup \- 5/6 * Dubai Sheema Classic – 9 * Queen Elizabeth Stakes (AUS) – 8/9 * Champions Mile (Hong Kong) \- 9/10 * Queen Elizabeth II Cup (QEII Cup – Hong Kong) – 15/17 * Metropolitan Handicap (Met Mile) – 7 *Prince of Wales's Stakes – 15 * Takarazuka Kinen – 6 * Eclipse Stakes – 21 *Durban July Handicap (South Africa) – 17 *King George VI and Queen Elizabeth Stakes (King George) – 24/26 * Whitney Stakes – 6 * Sussex Stakes – 26/27 * Pacific Classic – 7/8 * Prix Jacques le Marois \- 21/23 *International Stakes – 21/22 * Irish Champion Stakes \- 25/27 * Prix Vermeille \- 22/23 *Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe \- 23/25 * Queen Elizabeth II Stakes – 23 * Champion Stakes – 18/20 * Cox Plate – 10/13 * Breeders' Cup Mile \- 16/21 * Breeders' Cup Distaff – 10/11 * Breeders' Cup Turf – 17/18 *Breeders' Cup Classic \- 5 * Japan Cup – 5 * Hong Kong Sprint – 8/10 * Arima Kinen – 4 Other races of interest: * Cheltenham Gold Cup \- 10/11 * Ascot Gold Cup – 15/22 * Melbourne Cup – 10/12
